title: Airplanes Get Fixed After Sun Warning
summary: Thousands of Airbus airplanes were grounded because a warning said solar radiation could mess up their computers. This made some flights delayed or cancelled. Airbus, a big company in France, fixed most planes with a quick software update, but about 900 older planes needed new computers. Officials said the updates went smoothly, and many planes are flying again. In some places like the US, it was harder because it happened during a busy travel time called Thanksgiving. Airlines like American Airlines and Delta had some delays, but in the UK, airports like Heathrow had no big problems. The issue was found after a plane had to emergency land in October, hurting some people. Now, things are getting back to normal.

background_read: Airplanes use computers to fly safely. Sometimes, things like solar radiation from the sun can cause problems with these computers. Airbus is a company that builds many airplanes used by airlines around the world. When a problem is found, they fix it with updates to keep everyone safe. This article talks about how they fixed a recent issue and got planes flying again after some delays.
Article_Structure: WHO: Airbus, airlines like American Airlines and Delta, and officials like French Transport Minister
WHAT: Thousands of Airbus planes were grounded due to a solar radiation warning affecting flight computers, but most were fixed with software updates
WHERE: Affected countries include France, US, UK, and Australia, with airports like Paris Charles de Gaulle and London Gatwick
WHY: To prevent safety risks after a plane emergency landed, and to restore normal flight operations quickly
